title: Desktop Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mississippi State University in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was one panel interview. I was able to gain interview experience and to learn a lot from the people who was interviewing me. I felt like the interview went great and the overall experience was positive. After leaving the interview I had a better understanding of the position.
Interview Questions: What is BSOD? & How do you fix it

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: For the specific student position, a presentation do class material was required. The interview began with the five minute presentation followed by a series a common interview questions. Overall, the process is easy and quick.
Interview Questions: How would you answer a student’s question if you did not have the answer?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was nice and easy. First, there was a phone interview with everyone who worked in the office. Then, there was an in person inter view with everyone in the office.
Interview Questions: What are some skills you could offer the office?

title: Public Affairs Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy. Met with a panel and had to wait on the panel lead because he was late returning from lunch with his wife. Q&A went well but was told afterward mine was a token interview because they were promoting an intern to the full-time position. Complete waste of a 3-hour drive on my part.
Interview Questions: Inquired repeatedly about willingness to work after hours

title: Information Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview done throughout the day with a group of interested students just like me. There were a couple of people interviewed with in one go, but everyone was very welcoming.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want this job?

How many hours would you most likely to take?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Raymond, MS)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy and was composed of basic questions.  Knowing how to work on a computer and Microsoft office is essential. They also asked how my "People" skills were as well.
Interview Questions:
Are you good with Microsoft Office (Word, Powerpoint, Excel, etc.)

What are your weaknesses/Strengths?

title: Intramural Referee Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Mississippi State, MS) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very easy and to the point. There's no need to be nervous at all. The interviewees are very nice and they outline all expectations of the job. It is also very easy to setup direct deposit and all things needed for the job .
Interview Questions: Are you at least a part-time student at Mississippi State University?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: Process is very standard simple. I  applied through the job portal, Once my CV was selected , I was asked  then asked to submit a project within  5 days, then video call with team followed by HR round. Smooth and easy!
Interview Questions: Some technical question about the design.

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Basic: filled in paperwork on coursework and was asked what I want to teach. Interview consisted of questions on how I like to teach. Nothing difficult. Just scheduled a meeting after they emailed me that my coursework was good.
Interview Questions: What is your response to a student who isn't understanding your explanations?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Mississippi State University in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple to schedule as well as coordinate within my schedule! The interview itself was pretty laid back and allowed me to act like myself and answer questions as comfortable as possible.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength?

title: Undergrad Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and casual, with the professor I worked for. She asked basic questions about me and my experience. It was for a science lab so all questions pertained to that. The interview was easy and only lasted for about 15  minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job and how will it help you with your future career?

title: Conference Housing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was purely behavioral and job specification. It was just one phone-screen and my interviewer was super nice and accommodating. It last between 20 to 30 mins. Overall I had a good time interviewing.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself? 
Why this job?

title: Athletic Academic Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mississippi State University in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very laidback! Questions asked about experience with tutoring and situational questions. Also, ask if I knew any athletes. Great part time job while in undergrad. Lots of opportunity for growth.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a student being distracted while in tutoring?

title: Athletic Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was pretty laid back, and the interviewer was very nice and easy to talk to. I recommend elaborating on your previous tutoring experience professionally or even with younger siblings.
Interview Questions: Do you have any connections with any athletes?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a job for an undergraduate research assistant in MSU. Interview was pretty awesome. It was about data science role. I was asked questions related to Machine learning, data visualization, datq cleaning and manipulation.
Interview Questions: Project I have done and explain in detail about it.

title: Animal Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a single interviewer asking about qualifications and informing me of what the position entailed. Included a brief tour of the facility. Overall a positive interview process where I felt genuinely as though I was being considered for the position and that it was a good work environment.
Interview Questions: What is one of your most negative traits?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Remote interview, then campus visit. Research talk and teaching demo, numerous meetings with various faculty and administration. Packed schedule, everything took place on the same day, very exhausting, starting at 7pm, ending at 9pm.
Interview Questions: Describe an instance in the classroom that didn't go well, and how you dealt with it/ learned from it.

title: Freshman Year Navigator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: First, we had group interviews. If you were asked back, you had an individual interview. Dress was business casual for individual interview. There were multiple interviewers in the room, consisting of the director of Student Success and other current navigators. It was a laid back process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a freshman year navigator?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is fairly easy depending on the type of position you are going after. In lower staff positions, you are usually interviewed by the Department Head and then by all of the Staff members as a whole. It can seem a little tense but everyone is super nice and listen well. Another thing is they support growth big time.
Interview Questions: What are your goals?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: Process started aith the review of my  academic profile.  They check scores, labour experience, previous relevant research work, etc. They requested my Toefl scores and curriculum vitae. Then they had to analyze with the school board if I was eligible for the program.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be part of the field you are applying to?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is different from each semester. Sometimes they are speed dating style from supervisor to supervisor. Other times they range from group presentations and pitches to practical interviews with a large group of candidates.
Interview Questions: What is one policy you would like to see changed?

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: Skype Interview with basic questions and answers, was notified within a few days that I had gotten the position . Applied to multiple assistantships and had to choose which one I wanted.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation where a student disclosed something confidential to you that you had to report?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Simple fast and professional. The administrator was very understanding and caring. She was open for suggestions and schduling times. The process took roughly 3-5 days. 1st day I applied in-person, the very next day I was interviewed, and within 3 days I was accepted.
Interview Questions: Future Goals

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very laid back and pretty brief. I had an opportunity to talk about myself and my strengths and also to find out more about the job itself. I actually enjoyed the interview
Interview Questions: What future career plans do you have

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: It was easy, only formality , Interview with team members and PI of the project.Then demo lectures on teaching programing and physics. It was good experience , they were very supportive during entire process
Interview Questions: basic statistics, programing and physics

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Get know an RA and get the low down on the upper level staff.

Standard interview portion: summer campy questions, diversity questions, time management questions.

Group portion: Speak up just enough, know when to take a backseat, try to impress the right people.
Interview Questions:
How do you manage personal time with school?

What organizations are you involved with?

How can MSU improve?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mississippi State University in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and easy. I was called in asked about my experience and offered a job the same day. It felt a little rushed, but the same day the offer was nice. I was given a day or two to decide if i would like the job.
Interview Questions: What is my previous experience?

title: Group Ex Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: Had to perform a  demo for multiple members of the fitness center to show I was proficient in all aspects of group fitness and to show I communicated well with all subjects and conducted a well-rounded class
Interview Questions: How can you deal with class members that do not follow your instructions?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS)
Interview Descriptions: Formal one on one with the professor who was hiring. Cordial environment. They showed me around the department and lab. Was also introduced to the research collaborators and they in turn asked a few casual questions about my previous experience.
Interview Questions:
Basic questions about previous research experience, my publications, my research
skills

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Professional interview, should dress in business professional wear. Asked a lot of questions about diversity. Multiple rounds of interviews. Some in large group settings, small group settings, and some one on one interviews.
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mississippi State University in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied via website. Was asked to come in to an interview. 3 staff members interviewed me over about 30 mins. Felt great about the interview. Odd questions about personality mostly. It's been 2 weeks and no call back yet. Hopefully I will receive a call at least telling me I am no longer considered. Being left in the dark is no fun..
Interview Questions: What's your favorite color.

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral Questions which was unusual for the position I applied for. I feel like they were too serious about my interview taking in consideration how much I was paid
Interview Questions:
How do you manage stress?
What are your strength and weakness?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: Application process was smooth. Received prompt responses that helped me decide that I wanted to come here. Got funding early and decided to come here after interactions with my employer.
Interview Questions: Why Mississippi State University and not others?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Just had one interview.  If you have a good GPA and have an A in the class you are about to tutor, then they will take you. The experience is good too. Builds your knowledge. So, can start the work if you want some extra cash.
Interview Questions: Describe leadership skills?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line (on the university employment website) followed by a phone interview with no advance warning (just a cold call). After the phone interview I was contacted again to schedule the face to face interview process.  I was interviewed and after a week or so offered the position
Interview Questions: Do I have a sense of Humor?  I thought that was an odd question

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: You apply online through their job site. The director contacts you and asks if you'd like to have an interview. It could be a phone interview first and then an in-person interview. Takes place in a conference room. Asks a short list of questions to gauge your experience and interest in the job. Lets you ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: What do you see as the most challenging aspect?

title: Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very thorough and laid back. They made feel very comfortable. It was a pretty average interview as far as the questions asked, but I felt more comfortable during this interview than any other interview I've been through. Also, some of the nicest people I've ever met were present during the process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Talked with research engineers about the job high level. They had me describe past experience and we talked about courses I've taken so far at MSU. Interviewers were nice, and interested in past experience. You do not need to have prior internship experience for this job, most of my colleagues do not.
Interview Questions: What is the most valuable thing you learned from your internship?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very casual. We discussed what they were looking for and my particular set of skills towards the job. After discussing everything and being shown around, we talked about hourly pay. I then accepted the job.
Interview Questions: what experience do you have with this type of software?

title: Information Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was an online application and then you got called to an in person interview. After that interview,  the SRAs would have a meeting and draft to pick who they wanted for their IA staff.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an irate resident or parent?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Mississippi State University in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: In case of Graduate Research Assistant position, you will need to first get you graduate application approved. Then you are considered for these kind of position by faculty directly. They will email you if further details are needed. I was directly sent an offer letter. The faculty was very responsive and laid back throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Some technical questions from resume and sop.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: I was required to develop and present a 15-20 minutes presentation for the director of the office and a few of the other office members. It consisted of my background and how I planned to add value to the program. Afterwards, they asked questions for about 20-15 minutes.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: You are typically interview in the Director's office face to face. He will ask you about your resume and why you wish to work for DASI. The Director is extremely nice and friendly and intelligent and knowledgeable. He is a passionate guy who will just try and see if you are a good fit and determine which project.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for DASI at Mississippi State University.

title: Athletic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very casual. I showed up after a workout in my gym clothes. The staff is extremely inviting and makes you feel comfortable. Very easy questions were asked. They just want to make sure you are able to communicate and can be a reliable candidate. Also, they accept people of various backgrounds. It really depends on what subject tutors they need. I specialized in math/physics. They also do personal tutoring to keep the students on track in general.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness? How do you overcome it?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: I had to talk to my boss for about 10 minutes about when I am available to work and if I am reliable
Interview Questions: nothing that was asked was to difficult to answer

title: GTA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: Letter from graduate office asking
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Housing Assignments Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very personal interview. Just go get a application and email it to Coordinator. Took a couple days to get an email about coming in to interview. Was offered job on the spot
Interview Questions: What is your work ethic like?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mississippi State University
Interview Descriptions: If your professor likes you and he has a place in his lab and your GRE scores are good. He will accept you
Interview Questions: questions ar asked based on your experince

title: Senior Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS)
Interview Descriptions: Submit resume and application to HR via website.  Interview was conducted solely by department and involved a group interview of 12 staff members.  Each staff member asked 1 or 2 questions.  Interview lasted about 30 minutes.  Received offer within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Only typical interview questions were asked.  There were none that were very difficult.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mississippi State University in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for a graduate research assistant position. I received an email from one of the professors who said is interested in working with me.  He scheduled a phone interview. It was not too much tough. We mainly discussed my background and the way I can help his research team. He asked me to send him some of my latest academic achievements.  After, few days I received a job offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are the best for this position

title: Humphrey Coliseum Grad Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Like most interviews, your employers want to know that you can in fact due the job in question.  They were mainly concerned with my ability to handle stress and how I deal with problems.  I had previously worked in student housing where I had several residents that were suicidal.  I think I can handle a little stress from people whose ultimate goal is not to end their own lives.  With that being said, these employers also look for someone with a decent work history.  This is also true for most employers.  They want you to have work experience and most of all experience with people.  If you can meet these qualifications, you will probably have a good shot at getting one of these positions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Information Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Group interviews, so many other people. Absolutely have to know someone to get a job. So many other people taking interviews at the same time it was impossible to stand out on your own.
Interview Questions: What would you do during downtime?

title: Event Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very Informative and asked a lot about who I was and what I was attempting to accomplish while in school. Friendly staff that was welcoming and helped me learn fast.
Interview Questions: How many hours of classes are you taking?

title: Postdoctoral Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mississippi State University in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and online submission
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were very typical

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Met with the department head. He asked me about 30 minutes worth of questions about web development. Overall, it was a pleasant interview.
Interview Questions: All very standard questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was fun and its more about what you did in your undergraduate studies, what kind of background you have and how you can contribute to the research in view.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult i did my research on the professor that is hiring me and knew his are of interest

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mississippi State University (Starkville, MS) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: I put my interview in with the Business Outreach center and was called in an interview within days.
Interview Questions: Describe your strengths and weaknesses
